(1)For MBP fusion expression (Fig. 1B), the commercial vector pET-28a was first modified by inserting a sequence encoding MBP (Fig. 2). This was achieved by amplifying the MBP coding sequence with primers 3 and 4 (Table 1) using vector pMal-c2x as the template and inserting the NdeI and BamHI double digested PCR product into similarly digested pET-28a. 
(2)Next, the PCR amplified birA gene was digested with EcoRI and NotI, and ligated into the modified pET-28a plasmid doubly digested with the same enzymes. 
(3)The resultant construct for MBP fusion expression was named MBP-BirA/pET-28a.
